Uses of Class
colorguard.Piece

    • Uses of Piece in colorguard

      Subclasses of Piece in colorguard 
      Modifier and Type Class Description
      class  BasicPiece
      BasicPiece is a type of Piece with the ability to move 2 squares in each direction.
      class  Diagonal
      The Diagonal class is a type of Piece and thus extends Piece.
      class  Hopper
      Hopper is a type of Piece that can jump over other Pieces by default Can move 3 spaces in all directions Hopper can be neutralized by HighWall Powerup
      class  LongRange
      LongRange is a type of Piece that can move 6 spots vertically.
      class  Teleporter
      Teleporter is a type of Piece that can move in a 5 by 5 grid around the Piece
      Methods in colorguard that return Piece 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      Piece Clone.getClone​(Piece p, Location loc)
      Returns a clone for Piece p that lasts 6 turns and is of the same type as Piece
      Piece GameBoard.getPiece​(int r, int c)
      Gets the Piece at given Location (r, c)
      Methods in colorguard that return types with arguments of type Piece 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      java.util.Queue<Piece> GameBoard.blueJailBreak​()
      Clears the blueJail and outputs all Pieces freed

      java.util.Queue<Piece> Paralysis.getSurrounding​(Piece p, GameBoard g)
      Gets all enemy pieces in a 7 by 7 around given Piece p
      java.util.Queue<Piece> Colorguard.jailbreak​()
      Activates a jailbreak for the current turn
      java.util.Queue<Piece> GameBoard.redJailBreak​()
      Clears the redJail and outputs all Pieces freed
      Methods in colorguard with parameters of type Piece 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      void Colorguard.addPiece​(Piece p)
      Adds given Piece to the board
      void GameBoard.addPiece​(Piece p)
      Adds given Piece p to board and its Piece list (bluePieces or redPieces)
      void Clone.deactivate​(Piece p)
      Disactivates this Powerup for given Piece p
      void HighJump.deactivate​(Piece p)

      Disactivates this Powerup for given Piece p

      void Swapper.deactivate​(Piece p)  
      void TagRadius.deactivate​(Piece p)  
      void Throw.deactivate​(Piece p)  
      boolean Clone.effect​(Piece p)
      Has no impact for Clone class
      boolean HighJump.effect​(Piece p)
      Gives Piece p ability to jump over defenses
      boolean HighWall.effect​(Piece p)
      No effect for HighWall
      boolean Invincibility.effect​(Piece p)
      Makes given piece invincible
      boolean Invisibility.effect​(Piece p)
      Makes Piece p invisible for 4 turns
      boolean Jailbreak.effect​(Piece p)
      This method has no purpose for Jailbreak
      boolean MoveBoost.effect​(Piece p)
      Makes given piece invincible
      boolean Paralysis.effect​(Piece p)
      Has no impact for Paralysis class
      abstract boolean Powerup.effect​(Piece p)
      Applies an effect on given Piece p
      boolean RoleReversal.effect​(Piece p)
      Gives Piece p ability to tag opponents on the other side
      boolean Swapper.effect​(Piece p)
      No effect for Swapper class
      boolean Swapper.effect​(Piece p1, Piece p2)
      Swaps given 2 pieces
      boolean TagRadius.effect​(Piece p)
      Gives Piece p ability to tag opponents in a 5 by 5 square
      boolean Throw.effect​(Piece p)
      Gives Piece p ability to throw flag
      boolean Paralysis.effectEnemy​(Piece p)
      Paralyses given Piece p for
      Piece Clone.getClone​(Piece p, Location loc)
      Returns a clone for Piece p that lasts 6 turns and is of the same type as Piece
      java.util.Queue<Piece> Paralysis.getSurrounding​(Piece p, GameBoard g)
      Gets all enemy pieces in a 7 by 7 around given Piece p
      boolean Colorguard.isMoved​(Piece p)
      Tells if given Piece has been moved or not on this turn
      void GameBoard.movePiece​(Piece p, Location loc)
      Moves given Piece p to Location loc on the board overrides original Piece at that location
      void Colorguard.pieceMoved​(Piece p)
      Adds given Piece to movedPieces
      void GameBoard.sendPieceToJail​(Piece p)
      Sends given Piece p to blueJail or redJail, and moves it to an open jail spot
      void GameBoard.swapLocations​(Piece p1, Piece p2)
      Helper method for Throw Powerup usage - Swaps two Pieces locations on the grid
      Method parameters in colorguard with type arguments of type Piece 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      boolean HighWall.effect​(java.util.LinkedList<Piece> opponentPieces)
      Prevents all opposing pieces from jumping over defenders
      boolean Jailbreak.effect​(java.util.LinkedList<Piece> pieces)
      Gets all given pieces out of all jail
